questions.question: What is the difference between correlation and causation?

answers.a: Correlation refers to a cause-and-effect relationship, while causation refers to a statistical association between variables.
answers.b: Correlation refers to a statistical association between variables, while causation refers to a cause-and-effect relationship.

explanations.a: This statement is incorrect. Correlation does not imply causation; it simply measures the degree of association between variables.
explanations.b: Correlation measures the statistical association between variables, while causation refers to a cause-and-effect relationship where one variable directly influences another.
